meanings.definition: Used to introduce a clause or sentence expressing a statement or hypothesis.
meanings.sent1: I know that you are busy.
meanings.sent2: She said that the sky is blue.
meanings.sent3: It's so cold outside that even the birds are shivering.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was so deep that it felt like an ocean.
meanings.sent5: The fact that he always arrives late is quite frustrating.

meanings.definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed by the speaker.
meanings.sent1: Is that your book on the table?
meanings.sent2: That is the cat that always meows at night.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe that you ate the whole cake!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like that of a mischievous fairy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of that train passing by is so loud.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a subordinate clause expressing a reason or cause.
meanings.sent1: She was so tired that she fell asleep on the couch.
meanings.sent2: He missed the bus, so he had to walk to school.
meanings.sent3: The rain was so heavy that even the umbrella couldn't keep him dry.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was so contagious that everyone around him started smiling.
meanings.sent5: The fact that he always forgets his keys is quite amusing.
